品.definition: (bound form) article; commodity; product; goods; (bound form) grade; rank; kind; type; variety; character; disposition; nature; temperament; to taste sth; to sample; to criticize; to comment; to judge; to size up; fret (on a guitar or lute)

品味.definition: to sample; to taste; to appreciate; one's taste (i.e. in music, literature, fashion, food and drink etc); good taste

品嚐.definition: to have a taste of; to sample

品學.definition: conduct and learning (of an individual); moral nature and skill

品學兼優.definition: excelling both in morals and studies (idiom); top marks for studies and for behavior (at school); a paragon of virtue and learning

品川.definition: Shinagawa River; Shinagawa district of Tokyo

品控.definition: quality control (QC), abbr. for 品質控制|品质控制

品服.definition: costume; ceremonial dress (determining the grade of an official)

品格.definition: one's character; fret (on fingerboard of lute or guitar)

品相.definition: condition; physical appearance (of a museum piece, item of food produced by a chef, postage stamp etc)

品秩.definition: (old) rank and salary of an official post

品茗.definition: to taste tea; to sip tea

品茶.definition: to taste tea; to sip tea

品讀.definition: to read mindfully; to read with full engagement

品質.definition: character; intrinsic quality (of a person); quality (of a product or service, or as in "quality of life", "air quality" etc)

品酒.definition: to taste wine; to sip wine

品鑒.definition: to judge; to examine; to evaluate

品頭論足.definition: lit. to assess the head and discuss the feet (idiom); minute criticism of a woman's appearance; fig. to find fault in minor details; nitpicking; overcritical
